is a vast desert region dividing
. Its a hot, dry and often picturesque area. This area is not to be confused with another region further south often called Moroccan Western Sahara.

value: – The Gate of Sahara, this small city is located on the way of Erg Chebbi Dunes.
- This small oasis town lies near the northwest edge of the Sahara.
– Small village on the edge of Erg Chebbi Dunes.
- This small village lies on the southwest edge of Erg Chebbi.
– Considered the capital of the south, a great example of preservation and tourism that hasn't destroyed the feel of a fantastic and ancient city.
– Small village on the border with Algeria, south of Zagora town.
– Small desert town south of Ouarzazate.

; full of old kasbahs and surrounded by palm groves and the
– Biggest town north of Erfoud. Military use of this town gives it a clean and organized urban net.

French is widely spoken by most people connected to some kind of business. Moroccan Sahara divides into Berbers and Arabs from different tribes.

value: Berber: righ ian assir limoun; Arabic: bghit wahid assir limoun; French: je veux un jus d'orange;
: yan, sin, krad, kkuz, semmus, sdis, sa, ttam, ttza, mraw; Moroccan Arabic: wahed, juj, tleta, arbaa, remsa, setta, sebaa, tamanya, tsaa, aashra;
: un, deux, trois, quatre, cinq, six, sept, huit, neuf, dix;

Getting around Moroccan Sahara desert is as easy as it gets. You have plenty of buses and grands taxis connecting all imaginable cities, towns and villages.

value: name=Unesco Ksar of Ait Ben Haddou in Ouarzazate
alt=Unesco Ksar of Ait Ben Haddou in Ouarzazate
content=Unesco Ksar of Ait Ben Haddou in Ouarzazate

Try to do the circle from Ouarzazate to Nkob, Rissani, Erfoud, Erg Chebbi Dunes with villages such as Merzouga, Hassilabied, Khamlia, back up passing the Rose Valley and Gorges du Todra back to Ouarzazate. Also could be the southern route of Ouarzazate, Agdz, Zagora, Mhamid.

In Ouarzazate explore Oasis Fint, Oasis Skoura, Unesco Ksar of Ait ben Haddou, Tifoultoute Kasbah, Stork Kasbah, Taourirt Kasbah, Cinema Museum, Open air Cinema Studios, Saturday morning market;

content=Kasbah Meteorite is an hotel located 13km West of Alnif, a small Berber town on the road connecting Marrakech and Ouarzazate to Rissani in Sahara Desert.
content=Desert Tea is most of times just Chinese green tea and plenty of sugar. Ask for mint just for a change.

content=If you're not used to Moroccan water, most likely you'll get sick of drinking it. Get bottled water selling in all small groceries stores spread around all towns and villages. Water labels: Bahia, Sidi Ali, Sidi Harazem, Ciel (watch out for Ciel water, it is made to make you drink more water), Ain Saiss.

All Moroccan Sahara is safe. Be careful with heat, drink bottled water. Every little town and village have small shops selling bottled water (~6 Dirhams).

All small towns such

have plenty of good quality pharmacies where you can get most of necessary stuff.

Unemployment is high, and this is one of the countries touristic destination. Expect young boys proposing guidance through the desert. You are not obliged to, so if you don't want don't pressure yourself getting one, just smile and say no.
